20101206141522.000|20101206141527.000|TR0|
20101206141527.000|20101206141532.000|TR0|A French court has found U.S.
20101206141532.000|20101206141535.333|TR0|Continental Airlines criminally
20101206141535.333|20101206141538.667|TR0|responsible for the crash of the
20101206141538.667|20101206141542.000|TR0|Concorde supersonic jet outside
20101206141542.000|20101206141545.333|TR0|Paris a decade ago. 113 people
20101206141545.333|20101206141548.667|TR0|were killed in the accident,
20101206141548.667|20101206141552.000|TR0|when the plane caught fire
20101206141552.000|20101206141555.333|TR0|shortly after take-off. The
20101206141555.333|20101206141558.667|TR0|court ruled the crash was caused
20101206141558.667|20101206141602.000|TR0|by a piece of metal from a
20101206141602.000|20101206141607.000|TR0|Continental jet that was left on
20101206141607.000|20101206141612.000|TR0|the runway. The company has been
20101206141612.000|20101206141615.333|TR0|ordered to pay a 200 thousand
20101206141615.333|20101206141618.667|TR0|Euro fine, and one million euros
20101206141618.667|20101206141622.000|TR0|to the Concorde's operator Air
20101206141622.000|20101206141625.333|TR0|France. Continental says it will
20101206141625.333|20101206141628.667|TR0|appeal the decision saying the
20101206141628.667|20101206141632.000|TR0|verdict serves only French
